title: Ahrens Bakery Sign Fonts
content:
Can anyone identity the font used for "BAKERY" and "RESTAURANT" in this sign? If not a font/typeface, would you please recommend something similar?

It would also be great to know what script (or a similar one) is used for Ahrens. Thanks very much.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417025058im_/http:/typophile.com/files/AHRENS-BAKERY-SIGN_5233.png)
author: bfingeroth

comments.content:
Had no luck finding something that completely matched Bakery. These two typefaces get most of it right, save for the squared-off |B| and |R|, and the fully flat-topped |A|:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/type-together/abril-titling/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417025058/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/type-together/abril-titling/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/type-together/abril-titling/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/trivia-serif-10/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417025058/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/trivia-serif-10/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/trivia-serif-10/")

I found a similar |B| in a typeface that used to be offered by Linotype, Myfonts, and Fontshop, but now I can only find dubious sources for it:  
 [http://fontsgeek.com/fonts/Napoleon-Light-Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417025058/http:/fontsgeek.com/fonts/Napoleon-Light-Bold "http://fontsgeek.com/fonts/Napoleon-Light-Bold")

Ibis, by Font Bureau, might be helpful for the |B| and |A| as well:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/ibis-display/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417025058/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/ibis-display/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/ibis-display/")

Thorowgood also gets the flat-topped |A|, slab serifs, and the curly-footed |R| right, and would only require some artificial widening and some squaring off of the |B| and |R|:  
 [http://www.fonts.com/font/wooden-type-foundry/thorowgood/regular](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417025058/http:/www.fonts.com/font/wooden-type-foundry/thorowgood/regular "http://www.fonts.com/font/wooden-type-foundry/thorowgood/regular")

These might work for Restaurant:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/search/Alcalde/fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417025058/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/Alcalde/fonts/ "http://www.myfonts.com/search/Alcalde/fonts/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/westside/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417025058/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/westside/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/westside/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/intellecta/french-clarendon-n2/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417025058/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/intellecta/french-clarendon-n2/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/intellecta/french-clarendon-n2/")

Ahrens is most definitely hand-lettered, but these script faces capture the same general feel:  
 [http://www.chank.net/freefont\_detail.php?sku=1080](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417025058/http:/www.chank.net/freefont_detail.php?sku=1080 "http://www.chank.net/freefont\_detail.php?sku=1080")  
 [http://artandsignstudio.com/signwriter.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417025058/http:/artandsignstudio.com/signwriter.html "http://artandsignstudio.com/signwriter.html")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/search/az+cupcakes/fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417025058/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/az+cupcakes/fonts/ "http://www.myfonts.com/search/az+cupcakes/fonts/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fenotype/no.-seven/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417025058/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fenotype/no.-seven/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fenotype/no.-seven/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/wonder-brush/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417025058/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/wonder-brush/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/wonder-brush/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typesetit/praise/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417025058/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typesetit/praise/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typesetit/praise/") [Swash]

BAKERY is interesting. Some letters are almost a perfect match for Abril Titling Bold but the bowls on \_B\_ and \_R\_ are squared in a style developed by Imre Reiner as Corvinus in 1929-34. So what changes to Abril would produce an alphabet that was consistent with BAKERY?  
Consider Abril Titling Bold BRSPDCG

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417025058im_/http:/typophile.com/files/AbrilTitlingBoldAsBAKERY_4110.gif)
  
Compared to Corvinius BRSPDCG Skyline
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417025058im_/http:/typophile.com/files/CorviniusSkylineAsBAKERY_6588.gif)
  
Don

BAKERY. Another squared bowls font, designed by by Wolff Olins in 1978 for Renault automobiles. The matching weight is somewhere between Renault Medium

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417025058im_/http:/typophile.com/files/RenaultMedAsBAKE_5097.gif)
 abd Renault Bold 
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417025058im_/http:/typophile.com/files/RenaultBoldAsBAKE_4379.gif)
 Various foundries including [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/renault/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417025058/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/renault/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/renault/")  
Don
